1 The former treatise have I made, O Theophilus, of all that ĐCGiê-su began both to do Và teach, 2 Until the day in which he was taken up, after that he through the Holy Ghost had given commandments unto the apostles whom he had chosen: 3 To whom also he shewed himself alive after his passion by many infallible proofs, being seen of them forty days, Và speaking of the things pertaining to the kingdom của ĐCT: 4 Và, being assembled together with them, commanded them that they should not depart from Giê-ru-sa-lem, Nhưng wait for lời hứa of the Father, which, nói he, ye have heard of me. 5 For Giăng truly baptized with water; Nhưng ye shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost not many days hence. 6 When they therefore were come together, they asked of him, saying, Lord, wilt thou at this time restore again the kingdom to I-sơ-ra-ên? 7 Và he nói unto them, It is not for you to know the times hay biểnsons, which the Father hath put in his own power. 8  Nhưng các ngươi sẽ nhận quyền phép

For Đa-vít speaketh concerning him, I foresaw the Lord always before my face, for he is on my right hand, that I should not be moved: Therefore did my heart rejoice, Và my tongue was glad; moreover also my flesh shall rest in hy vọng: Because thou wilt not leave my soul in hell, neither wilt thou suffer thine Holy One to see corruption. CHAPTER 17. bây giờ when they had passed through Amphipolis Và Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where was a nhà hội of the Jews: Và Phao-lô, as his manner was, went in unto them, Và ba ngày Sa-báts reasoned with them out of the scriptures, Opening Và alleging, that Christ must needs have suffered, Và risen again from the dead; Và that this ĐCGiê-su, whom I preach unto you, is Christ. Và some of them believed, Và consorted with Paul Và Silas; Và of the devout Greeks a great multitude, Và of the chief women not a few. Nhưng the Jews which believed not, moved with envy, took unto them certain lewd fellows of the baser sort, Và gathered a company, Và set all the city on an uproar, Và assaulted nhà of Jason, Và sought to bring them out to the people. Và when they found them not, they drew Jason Và certain anh em unto the rulers of the city, crying, These that have turned thế gian upside down are come hither also; Whom Jason hath received: Và these all do contrary to the decrees of Cæsar, saying that there is another king, one ĐCGiê-su. Và they troubled the people Và the rulers of the city, when they heard these things. Và when they had taken security of Jason, Và of the other, they let them go. Và the brethren tức thì sent away Phao-lô Và Silas by night unto Berea: who coming thither went into the nhà hội of the Jews. These were more noble than those in Thessalonica, in that they received the word with all readiness of mind, Và searched the scriptures daily, whether those things were so. Therefore many of them believed; also of honourable women which were Greeks, Và of men, not a few. Nhưng when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word của ĐCT was preached of Phao-lô at Berea, they came thither also, Và stirred up the people. Và then tức thì the brethren sent away Phao-lô to go as it were to biển: Nhưng Silas Và Ti-mô-thê abode there still. Và they that conducted Phao-lô brought him unto A-Thên: Và receiving a commandment unto Silas Và Ti-mô-thê for to come to him with all speed, they departed. bây giờ while Paul waited for them at A-Thên, his spirit was stirred in him, when he saw the city wholly given to idolatry. Therefore disputed he in the nhà hội with the Jews, Và with the devout persons, Và in the market daily with them that met with him. Then certain philosophers of the Epicureans, Và of the Stoicks, encountered him. Và some nói, What will this babbler say? other some, He seemeth to be a setter forth of strange gods: because he preached unto them ĐCGiê-su, Và the resurrection. Và they took him, Và brought him unto Areopagus, saying, May we know what this new doctrine, whereof thou speakest, is? For thou bringest certain strange things to our ears: we would know therefore what these things mean. (For all the Athenians Và strangers which were there spent their time in nothing else, but either to tell, or to hear some new thing.) Then Phao-lô stood in the midst of Mars' hill, và nói, Ye men of A-Thên, I perceive that in all things ye are too superstitious. For as I passed by, Và beheld your devotions, I found an altar with this inscription, TO THE UNKNOWN ĐCT. Whom therefore ye ignorantly worship, him declare I unto you. ĐCT that made thế gian Và all things therein, seeing that he is Lord of heaven Và đất, dwelleth not in temples made with hands; Neither is worshipped with men's hands, as though he needed any thing, seeing he giveth to all sự sống, Và breath, Và all things; Và hath made of một blood all nations of men for to dwell on all the face of the đất, Và hath determined the times before appointed, Và the bounds of their habitation; That they should seek the Lord, nếu haply they might feel after him, Và find him, though he be not far from every một of us: For in him we live, Và move, Và have our being; as certain also of your own poets have nói, For we are also his offspring. Forasmuch then as we are the offspring của ĐCT, we ought not to think that the Godhead is like unto gold, hay silver, hay stone, graven by art Và man's device. Và the times of this ignorance ĐCT winked at; Nhưng bây giờ commandeth all men every where to repent: Because he hath appointed a day, in the which he will judge thế gian in righteousness by that man whom he hath ordained; whereof he hath given assurance unto all men, in that he hath raised him from the dead. Và when they heard of the resurrection of the dead, some mocked: Và others nói, We will hear thee again of this matter. So Phao-lô departed from among them. Howbeit certain men clave unto him, Và believed: among the which was Dionysius the Areopagite, Và một người đờn bà named Damaris, Và others with them. CHAPTER 18. For thou shalt be his witness unto all men of what thou hast seen Và heard. Và bây giờ why tarriest thou? Hãy chổi dậy, Và be baptized, Và wash away thy tội lỗi, calling on the name của Chúa. Và xảy đến, that, when I was come again to Giê-ru-sa-lem, even while I prayed in the temple, I was in a trance; Và saw him saying unto me, Make haste, Và get thee quickly out of Giê-ru-sa-lem: for they will not receive thy testimony concerning me. Và I nói, Lord, they know that I imprisoned Và beat in every nhà hội them that believed on thee: Và when the blood of thy martyr Stephen was shed, I also was standing by, Và consenting unto his death, Và kept the raiment of them that slew him. Và he nói unto me, Depart: for I will send thee far hence unto the Gentiles. Và they gave him audience unto this word, Và then lifted up their voices, và nói, Away with such a fellow from the đất: for it is not fit that he should live. Và as they cried out, Và cast off their clothes, Và threw dust into the air, The chief captain commanded him to be brought into the castle, Và bade that he should be examined by scourging; that he might know wherefore they cried so against him. Và as they bound him with thongs, Phao-lô nói unto the centurion that stood by, Is it lawful for you to scourge một người that is a Roman, Và uncondemned? When the centurion heard that, he went Và told the chief captain, saying, Take heed what thou doest: for this man is a Roman. Then the chief captain đến, và nói unto him, Tell me, art thou a Roman? He nói, Yea. Và the chief captain trả lời, With a great sum obtained I this freedom. Và Phao-lô nói, Nhưng I was free born. Then tức thì they departed from him which should have examined him: Và the chief captain also was afraid, after he knew that he was a Roman, Và because he had bound him. On the morrow, because he would have known the certainty wherefore he was accused of the Jews, he loosed him from his bands, Và commanded các thầy tế lễ Và all their council to appear, Và brought Phao-lô down, Và set him before them. CHAPTER 23. Và Phao-lô, earnestly kìaing the council, nói, Men Và anh em, I have lived in all good conscience before God until this day. Và thầy thượng phẩm Ananias commanded them that stood by him to smite him on the mouth. Then nói Phao-lô unto him, ĐCT shall smite thee, thou whited wall: for sittest thou to judge me after the law, Và commandest me to be smitten contrary to the law? Và they that stood by nói, Revilest thou God's high priest? Then nói Phao-lô, I wist not, anh em, that he was thầy thượng phẩm: for it is written, Thou shalt not speak evil of the ruler of thy people. Nhưng when Paul perceived that the one part were Sadducees, Và the other những người Pha-ri-si, he cried out in the council, Men Và anh em, I am a người Pha-ri-si, the son of a người Pha-ri-si: of the hy vọng Và resurrection of the dead I am called in question. Và when he had so nói, there arose a dissension between the những người Pha-ri-si Và the Sadducees: Và đám đông was divided. For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, neither angel, nor spirit: Nhưng the những người Pha-ri-si confess both. Và there arose a great cry: Và những thầy chép luật that were of the những người Pha-ri-si' part arose, Và strove, saying, We find no evil in this man: Nhưng nếu a spirit hay an angel hath spoken to him, let us not fight against God. Và when there arose a great dissension, the chief captain, fearing lest Phao-lô should have been pulled in pieces of them, commanded quân lính to go down, Và to take him by force from among them, Và to bring him into the castle. Và the night following the Lord stood by him, và nói, Be of good cheer, Phao-lô: for as thou hast testified of me in Giê-ru-sa-lem, so must thou bear witness also at Rome. Và when it was day, certain of the Jews banded together, Và bound themselves under a curse, saying that they would neither eat nor drink till they had killed Phao-lô. Và they were more than forty which had made this conspiracy. Và they đến to các thầy tế lễ Và elders, và nói, We have bound ourselves under a great curse, that we will eat nothing until we have slain Phao-lô. bây giờ therefore ye with the council signify to the chief captain that he bring him down unto you to morrow, as though ye would enquire something more perfectly concerning him: Và we, or ever he come near, are ready to kill him. Và when Paul's sister's son heard of their lying in wait, he went Và entered into the castle, Và told Phao-lô. Then Phao-lô called một of the centurions unto him, và nói, Bring this young man unto the chief captain: for he hath a certain thing to tell him. So he took him, Và brought him to the chief captain, Và nói, Phao-lô the prisoner called me unto him, Và prayed me to bring this young man unto thee, who hath something to say unto thee. Then the chief captain took him by the hand, Và went with him aside privately, Và asked him, What is that thou hast to tell me? Và he nói, The Jews have agreed to desire thee that thou wouldest bring down Phao-lô to morrow into the council, as though they would enquire somewhat of him more perfectly. Nhưng do not thou yield unto them: for there lie in wait for him of them more than forty men, which have bound themselves with an oath, that they will neither eat nor drink till they have killed him: Và bây giờ are they ready, looking for a promise from thee. So the chief captain then let the young man depart, Và charged him, See thou tell không ai that thou hast shewed these things to me. Và he called unto him two centurions, saying, Make ready two hundred soldiers to go to Cæsarea, Và horsemen threescore and ten, Và spearmen two hundred, at the third hour of the night; Và provide them beasts, that they may set Phao-lô on, Và bring him safe unto Felix thống đốc. Và he wrote a letter after this manner: Claudius Lysias unto the most excellent governor Felix sendeth greeting. This man was taken of the Jews, Và should have been killed of them: then came I with an army, Và rescued him, having understood that he was a Roman. Và when I would have known the cause wherefore they accused him, I brought him forth into their council: Whom I perceived to be accused of questions of their law, Nhưng to have nothing laid to his charge worthy of death hay of bonds. Và when it was told me how that the Jews laid wait for the man, I sent tức thì to thee, Và gave commandment to his accusers also to say before thee what they had against him. Farewell. Then quân lính, as it was commanded them, took Phao-lô, Và brought him by night to Antipatris. On the morrow they left the horsemen to go with him, Và returned to the castle: Who, when they came to Cæsarea, Và delivered the epistle to thống đốc, presented Phao-lô also before him. Và when thống đốc had read the letter, he asked of what province he was. Và when he understood that he was of Cilicia; I will hear thee, nói he, when thine accusers are also come. Và he commanded him to be kept in Herod's judgment hall. CHAPTER 24. Và they nói unto him, chúng ta neither received letters out of xứ Giu-đê concerning thee, neither any of the brethren that came shewed hay spake any harm of thee. Nhưng we desire to hear of thee what thou thinkest: for as concerning this sect, we know that every where it is spoken against. Và when they had appointed him a day, there came many to him into his lodging; to whom he expounded Và testified the kingdom của ĐCT, persuading them concerning ĐCGiê-su, both out of the law of Môi-se, Và out of the prophets, from morning till evening. Và some believed the things which were spoken, Và some believed not.NOTE! Scrambled tags Và when they agreed not among themselves, they departed, after that Paul had spoken một word, Well spake the Holy Ghost by Ê-sai the prophet unto our fathers, Saying, Go unto this people, Và say, Hearing ye shall hear, Và shall not understand; Và seeing ye shall see, Và not perceive: For the heart of this people is waxed gross, Và their ears are dull of hearing, Và their mắt have they closed; lest they should see with their mắt, Và hear with their ears, Và understand with their heart, Và should be converted, Và I should heal them. Be it known therefore unto you, that the salvation của ĐCT is sent unto the Gentiles, Và that they will hear it. Và when he had nói these words, the Jews departed, Và had great reasoning among themselves. Và Phao-lô dwelt two whole years in his own hired house, Và received all that came in unto him, Preaching the kingdom của ĐCT, Và teaching those things which concern the Lord ĐCGiê-su Christ, with all confidence, không ai forbidding him.
